metadata.title: Wednesday, 17th July, 2013
metadata.session: SECOND SESSION OF THE ELEVENTH ASSEMBLY

questions.minister: Minister of Health whether the Government has any plans to introduce legislation that will make circumcision of male babies at birth compulsory.

parts: (a)    how many defilement cases were reported to the police from 2010 to 2012;
(b)    of the cases at (a), how many were prosecuted during the same period;
(c)    how many convictions were secured; and
(d)    whether the Government has any plans to introduce legislation that will make the offence of defilement non-bailable.
(a)  how many cases were referred by the Human Rights Commission for further consideration to the following organisations in 2010:
(i)    Legal Resources Foundation; (ii)   Legal Aid Board; (iii)  Ministry of Labour and Social Security; (iv) Police Public Complaints Authority;
(v)  Commission for Investigations; (vi) Zambia Police Force; and (vii)Zambia Prisons Service; and
(b)  why the Commission discontinued investigation of 86 complaints in the same year.

questions.minister: Minister of Defence what policy measures the Government has taken to ensure the following in the defence wings of the country
parts: (a)    elimination of nepotism and corruption in the recruitment of both officers and regular personnel; and
(b)    fair representation of personnel from all the ten provinces of Zambia.

questions.minister: Minister of Transport, Works, Supply and Communication
parts: (a)    how many airstrips, country-wide, were upgraded in 2012;
(b)    how many new airstrips were constructed in 2012; and
(c)    why the upgrading of the Chilubi Airstrip has delayed despite being included in the 2012 programme of work.

questions.minister: Minister of Transport, Works, Supply and Communication
parts: (a)    how much money was realised from the following weigh bridges between January, 2011 and March, 2013:
(i)    Kapiri-Mposhi; (ii)   Mpika; (iii)  Kafue; and (iv) Kafulafuta; and
(b)    whether the Government has any plans to construct a new weigh bridge between Lusaka and Kabwe in order to decongest the weigh bridge at Kapiri-Mposhi.

questions.minister: Minister of Transport, Works, Supply and Communication
parts: (a)    how many new drivers’ licences were issued in 2011 and 2012, year by year;
(b)    of the licences, how many were for Public Service Vehicles;
(c)    how many temporary drivers’ licences were issued in the same period; and
(d)    why it takes up to three months for the Road Transport and Safety Agency to process drivers’ licences.

questions.minister: Minister of Transport, Works, Supply and Communication
parts: (a)    how many motor vehicles were owned by the Government from 2009 to 2012, year by year;
(b)    of these vehicles, how many have since been sold off; and
(c)    how much money was raised from the sale, year by year.
(a)    how much money the country received in form of grants from the international community from 2009 to 2011, year by year; and
(b)    how much of the money was spent on infrastructure development in Luwingu District.

questions.minister: Minister of Mines, Energy and Water Development
parts: (a)    how much progress ZESCO Limited has made on improving power supply to the Northern Province through the Pensulo-Kasama Project; and

(b)    when the Rural Electrification Authority will electrify Lupososhi Parliamentary Constituency in Luwingu District. QUESTIONS FOR WRITTEN ANSWER W53    Mr Matafwali (Bangweulu) - to ask the Minister of Home Affairs:
(a)    how many people were deported from Zambia from January, 2007 to February, 2013, year by year; and
(b)    what the reasons for the deportations were. W54    Mr S Chungu (Luanshya) - to ask the Minister of Education, Science, VocationalTraining and Early Education:
(a)    why all masters degree holders were transferred from the following institutions in 2009;
(i)    National In-Service Teachers College (NISTOCOL); and (ii)    Livingstone College of Education;
(b)    how may holders of masters degrees were at Chalimbana University (formerly NISTCOL) as of March, 2013; and
(c)    how many students were enrolled at Chalimbana University under the following categories in 2013:
(i)    full-time; and (ii)    part-time/long distance. W55    Mr Matafwali (Bangweulu) - to ask the Minister of Defence:
(a)    how many officers retired from the Zambia National Service, from the rank of Second Lieutenant to that of Major, during the period January, 2011 to January, 2013; and
(b)    how many women from the Zambia Army, Zambia Airforce and Zambia National Service attained the following ranks as of December, 2012:
(i)    Lieutenant Colonel; (ii)   Colonel; (iii)  Brigadier General; (iv) Major General; and
(v)  Lieutenant General.
